description: Flags when group norms, cultural movements, or social momentum begin using peer pressure, moral language, or fear to control individual behavior without dialogue or mutual consent.

variables.N(t): Narrative leverage (moral superiority, fear of exclusion, shame)
variables.B(t): Dissent space (freedom to speak, interpret, or walk away)

response: When culture turns persuasive force into quiet coercion, diversity fades. Real strength allows questioning, difference, and breathing room. Boundaries keep communities humane.
